Title: Auto Map-Reduce Index
DescriptionLines: An **Auto Map-Reduce index** is created if no index is specified when issuing a query that performs data aggregation computations.
The Auto Map-Reduce Index will be created only if an Auto Map-Reduce Index that can answer this dynamic query does not exist yet.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define a dynamic query
DescriptionLines: * Define a dynamic query (note - no index is specified).
* The query in this demo will return _the number of employees in each country_ ,
for documents in the 'Employees' collection.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define what to Group-By
DescriptionLines: * Use `GroupBy()` to define the document field(s) on which to group by.
* In the above, grouping is done on the document field _'Address.Country'_.
'Address.Country' will be the grouping key.
* The computed results will be aggregated per country,
so that for each country you shall get its total number of employees.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define the aggregation action
DescriptionLines: * Define the aggregation action - _the computation to be done per grouping key_.
* Use:
* `SelectKeyWithNameAndProjectedName()` to define the key and its projected field name.
* `SelectCountWithName()` to define the count aggregation action and its projected field name.
* _Each entry in the result set will contain the following info fields_:
* The country name ( _Country_ )
* The total number of employees in this country ( _NumberOfEmployees_ )
* Each 'Employee' document represents 1 employee.
Here we are counting the number of documents that exist per unique country.
* Note: the supported aggregation actions with a dynamic query are:
`SelectCount` & `SelectSum`.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define results order
DescriptionLines: * Optionally, the query result set can be sorted according to any one of the fields defined in the previous step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Execute the dynamic query
DescriptionLines: * Upon query execution, the _query-optimizer_ will analyze the query to see if an Auto-Map-Reduce Index that can answer this query already exists.
* If such Auto-Map-Reduce Index (Not static one...) is found, it will be used to fetch the results.
Else, the query-optimizer will create a new Auto-Map-Reduce Index that can answer this query.
* With the above query, the following Auto-Map-Reduce Index will be created: _Auto/Employees/ByCountReducedByAddress.Country_.
* The _numberOfEmployeesPerCountry_ variable will hold the query results set.
Each entry in the result set will contain a unique country and the total number of employees in it.
* Note: the results are Not tracked by the session, as they are Not documents, but just data projected using the 'Select()' methods.
